Certainly! Here are some albums that blend jazz, funk, and blues that you might enjoy:

1. "Head Hunters" by Herbie Hancock - A classic fusion jazz album that features elements of funk, rock, and African rhythms.
2. "Thruster" by Charlie Hunter - A funky jazz album that features the unique guitar-bass hybrid playing of Charlie Hunter, as well as his soulful vocals.
3. "Still Crazy After All These Years" by Paul Simon - While not strictly a jazz or funk album, this 70s classic features a lot of jazz and R&B influences, as well as the funky bass playing of Anthony Jackson.
4. "The Crusaders 1" by The Crusaders - This album is a great example of 70s jazz-funk and features catchy melodies, funky grooves, and great horn arrangements.
5. "Blues and the Abstract Truth" by Oliver Nelson - A classic jazz album that features a blend of blues and jazz elements, as well as great solo work by Eric Dolphy, Freddie Hubbard, and Bill Evans.

I hope these recommendations fit your preferences! Let me know if you need any more suggestions.
